alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 9:09PM EST until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, New Haven. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 PM EST, The gauge at the Quinnipiac River at Wallingford is in minor flooding. Water levels there should recede below flood stage overnight. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Allen Brook, Butterworth Brook, Harbor Brook, Willow Brook, West River, Muddy River, Farm River, Quinnipiac River, Mill River, Meetinghouse Brook, Honeypot Brook, Wintergreen Brook and Fivemile Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
